meanings.definition: In a manner not in accordance with the code of chivalry.
meanings.sent1: He unchivalrously refused to help the old lady cross the street.
meanings.sent2: She spoke unchivalrously to her classmates, hurting their feelings.
meanings.sent3: The knight unchivalrously hogged all the food at the banquet.
meanings.sent4: His behavior was unchivalrously selfish, like a dragon hoarding treasure.
meanings.sent5: The villain unchivalrously tripped the hero during the jousting tournament.

meanings.definition: Without courtesy or honor towards others.
meanings.sent1: The unchivalrously rude man cut in line without apologizing.
meanings.sent2: Her unchivalrously disrespectful comments offended everyone present.
meanings.sent3: The cat unchivalrously stole the dog's bed, claiming it as her own.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered unchivalrously, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: His unchivalrously aggressive behavior made him unpopular among his peers.
